children.name: Pain scale
children.description: Patient-reported estimation of extent of pain on a scale of 0 to 100, where 0 indicates no pain and 100 indicates severe pain.

children.name: Pain VAS
children.description: Pain Visual Analogue Scale.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Any event
children.description: Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

children.name: Event Series
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Pain VAS
children.description: The subjective clinical history of the subject of care as recorded directly by the subject, or reported to a clinician by the subject or a carer.

children.name: 22. Pain interfering with normal work
children.description: Patient reported extent to which pain has interfered with normal work (both outside home and housework) during the past 4 weeks.

children.name: 35. Expect health to get worse
children.description: Patient reported assessment of whether they expect their health to get worse.

children.name: 33. Get sick easier than other people
children.description: Patient reported assessment of whether they seem to get sick a little easier than other people.

children.name: 36. Health is excellent
children.description: Patient reported assessment of whether they think their health is excellent.

children.name: 34. As healthy as anybody
children.description: Patient reported assessment of whether they are as healthy as anybody they know.

children.name: General health statements
children.description: Patient reported statements about health.

children.name: 18. Accomplished less
children.description: Patient reported statement whether they have accomplished less than they would like in the past 4 weeks as a result of emotional problems.

children.name: 17. Cut down time spent
children.description: Patient reported statement whether they have cut down the amount of time spent on work or other activities in the past 4 weeks as a result of emotional problems.

children.name: 19. Didn't do work as carefully as usual
children.description: Patient reported statement whether they didn't do work or other activities as carefully as usual in the past 4 weeks as a result of emotional problems.

children.name: Problems with work and daily activities emotional
children.description: Patient reported problems with work or other regular daily activities as a result of emotional problems.

children.name: 2. Health compared to 1 year ago
children.description: Patient reported rating of health in general now compared to one year ago.

children.name: 20. Extent of interference with normal social activities
children.description: Patient reported extent of physical health or emotional problems interfering with normal social activities with family, friends, neighbours or groups in the past 4 weeks.

children.name: 32. Amount of time of interference with social activities
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks their physical health or emotional problems have interfered with social activities.

children.name: 21. Bodily pain
children.description: Patient report extent of bodily pain in past 4 weeks.

children.name: 15. Limited in kind of work
children.description: Patient reported statement whether they have been limited in the kind of work or other activities in the past 4 weeks as a result of physical health.

children.name: 14. Accomplished less
children.description: Patient reported statement whether they have accomplished less than they would like in the past 4 weeks as a result of physical health.

children.name: 16. Difficulty performing work
children.description: Patient reported statement whether they have had difficulty in performing work or other activities in the past 4 weeks as a result of physical health.

children.name: Problems with work and daily activities physical
children.description: Patient reported problems with work or other regular daily activities as a result of physical health.

children.name: 1. Health in general
children.description: Patient reported rating of general health.

children.name: 30. Happy
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks they have been a happy person.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 27. A lot of energy
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks they have had a lot of energy.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 24. Very nervous
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time they have been a very nervous person during the past 4 weeks.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 29. Worn out
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks they have felt worn out.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 26. Calm and peaceful
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks they have felt calm and peaceful.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 23. Full of pep
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time in the past 4 weeks they have felt full of pep.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 25. Down in the dumps
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks they have felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer them up.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 31. Tired
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks they have felt tired.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: 28. Downhearted and blue
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how much of the time during the past 4 weeks they have felt downhearted and blue.

symbol.description: A good bit of the time

children.name: General feeling
children.description: Patient reported assessment of how they feel and how things have been during the past 4 weeks.

children.name: 4. Moderate activities
children.description: Patient reported extent of health-related limitations to moderate activities such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling or playing golf.

children.name: 3. Vigorous activities
children.description: Patient reported extent of health-related limitations to vigorous activities such as running, lifting heavy objects, participating in strenuous sports.

children.name: 5. Lifting or carrying groceries
children.description: Patient reported extent of health-related limitations to lifting or carrying groceries.

children.name: Limitations to activities during typical day
children.description: Patient reported extent of limitations to activities during a typical day.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: Point in time
children.description: A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.

children.name: Event Series
children.description: @ internal @

children.name: SF-36
children.description: 36-Item Short Form Survey.

children.name: ECIS procedure link
children.description: The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.

children.name: PROMS type
children.description: Identification information about the report.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

defining_code.description: This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
Request for procedure sent.
The procedure has been aborted.
The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.
The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.
The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.

This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure request sent' (at0007) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.
The procedure to be undertaken is planned.
The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.

This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
Request for procedure sent.
The procedure has been postponed.
The procedure has been aborted.
The procedure has been suspended.

children.name: Comment
children.description: Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.

children.name: Procedure name
children.description: Identification of the procedure by name.

children.name: Tree
children.description: @ internal @

defining_code.description: This pathway step has been deprecated as it was incorrectly associated with 'initial' status - use the new 'Procedure planned' (at0004) pathway step  which is correctly associated with 'planned' status.
The procedure has been suspended.
The procedure to be undertaken is planned.
The procedure has been postponed.
The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.
The procedure has been scheduled.
The procedure has been scheduled.

children.name: Procedure
children.description: A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.

tree.name: Generic PROMS
tree.description: Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.
